definition: to travel at double speed/to make all haste
double/twice/simultaneous/holding two or more (official) posts at the same time

sentences.english: Even while the earth sleeps we travel.
sentences.chinese: 我們會日夜兼程，即便大地還在熟睡。

sentences.english: We all trials and hardships to walk, past experience has stopped.
sentences.chinese: 我們一路風雨兼程地走來，過去的經歷已經定格。

sentences.english: Life is too short, the way it is, can not posthaste. ?
sentences.chinese: 人生太短暫了，事情是這樣的多，能不兼程而進嗎？

sentences.english: For the final 85-kilometre stretch, we decided to carry on all night.
sentences.chinese: 對於最後的85公里，我們決定星夜兼程。

sentences.english: Road in the distance, I still trials and hardships.
sentences.chinese: 路在遠方，我還在風雨兼程。

sentences.english: Your teachings urge me to the wind and rain, my heart till blessings with you day and night.
sentences.chinese: 您的教誨催我風雨兼程，我的祝福伴您晝夜心耕。

sentences.english: They have been traveling night and day for a whole week.
sentences.chinese: 他們日夜兼程已有整整一星期。

sentences.english: Gaving each other moving blessings day and night.
They travelled day and night without stopping.
Instructing you rush me trials and hardships, my blessings with you day and night.
sentences.chinese: 您的教誨催我風雨兼程，我的祝福伴您晝夜耕耘。

sentences.english: Life has no shortcut. Choosing an aim means marching in all weathers.
sentences.chinese: 生命是沒有捷徑的，選擇了前方就要風雨兼程。

sentences.english: They will travel by night as well as by day.
They will travel day and night.

sentences.chinese: 他開始日夜兼程的建設。

sentences.english: We shall travel by night as well as by day.
sentences.chinese: 我們就將日夜兼程去旅行了。

sentences.english: They have is traveling night and day for a whole week.
sentences.chinese: 日夜兼程已有整整一星期。

definition: to spur the horse to full speed (idiom)/to go as fast as possible
to set out (of troops)/departure/start date (of military expedition)
